data.title: Paris 2024 Olympic Games: who are the medal-winning sailing athletes? Final results
data.meta_description: The Paris 2024 Olympic Games run from July 26 to August 11, 2024! Athletes from all over the world have thus set down their suitcases in the capital (and all over France) to compete in their respective sports, and so try to win a medal. And speaking of medals, who are the athletes who won the Holy Grail in sailing and windsurfing in Marseille? We tell you all about them!
data.text:
With the Paris 2024 Olympics in full swing, athletes from all over the world are already competing for glory in Paris' beautiful, purpose-built stadiums. Athletes whose dream is to win a sacrosanct medal, be it gold, silver or bronze (but gold is better). And for those interested in sailing, windsurfing and water sports, we'd like to introduce you to the athletes who won medals at these Olympic Games!

To follow the sailing live on television and find out who has won a medal, discover therace calendar:

Paris 2024 Olympic Games: channels, schedules... All you need to know about sailing events on TV

That's it, the Paris 2024 Olympic Games are on! And for sailing fans who weren't able to get their ticket for the events in Marseille, don't panic: the events are being broadcast on TV! On which channels will you be able to watch the events, on which days and at what time? We tell you everything! [Read more]

The article will be updated during the Olympic Games, depending on the medals won, but you can already keep it as a bookmark/favorite on your browser.

To be read

Olympics Paris 2024: all the news and information about the Olympic Games

Paris 2024 Olympics: history, rules, athletes... everything you need to know about sailing and windsurfing

Paris 2024 Olympic Games: channels, schedules... All you need to know about sailing events on TV

Which athletes are the big winners in the sailing event at the Paris 2024 Olympics?

Friday, August 2

Skiff Men

Gold medal🥇: Botin / Trittel - Spain

Silver medal🥈: Mc Hardie / Mc Kenzie - New Zealand

Bronze medal🥉: Barrows / Henken - USA

Women'sskiff

Gold medal🥇: Odile Van Aanholt/Annette Duetz - Netherlands

Silver medal🥈: Vilma Bobeck/Rebecca Netzler - Sweden

Bronze medal🥉: Sarah Steyaert/Charline Picon - France

Wednesday, August 7th

Dinghy men

Gold medal🥇: Matt Wearn (Australia)

Silver medal🥈: Pavlos Kontides (Cyprus)

Bronze medal🥉: Stefano Peschiera (Peru)

Women's dinghy

Gold medal🥇: Marit Bouwmeester (Netherlands)

Silver medal🥈: Anne-Marie Rindom (Denmark)

Bronze medal🥉: Line Flem Hoest (Norway)

Thursday, August 8

Kite women

Gold medal🥇: Eleanor Alridge (Great Britain)

Silver medal🥈: Lauriane Nolot (France)

Bronze medal🥉: Annelous Lammerts (Netherlands)

Paris 2024: discover the medal table by country for these Olympic Games

The Paris 2024 Olympic Games is obviously the major sporting event of this summer, bringing together over 200 countries in the French capital. When it comes to medals, will France come out on top on home soil? We tell you all about it! [Read more]

French medallists?

Paris 2024 Olympics: Sarah Steyaert and Charline Picon win a bronze medal in Sailing

Olympic Games Paris 2024, sailing: Charline Picon and Sarah Steyaert win bronze in 49er FX. Charline Picon and Sarah Steyaert from La Rochelle won a bronze medal on the Marina de Marseille racecourse on Friday. It was the first French medal of the day. This medal marks an exceptional performance for the two sailors, who rose to a major challenge. [Read more]

Kitefoil: Lauriane Nolot wins a silver medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics in sailing

This Thursday, August 8, 2024, Lauriane Nolot finds herself in the kitefoil final, a new discipline at the Paris 2024 Olympics in the field of sailing. An opportunity to win the first Olympic medals in the history of this extreme sport. [Read more]

Paris 2024 Olympics: history, rules, athletes... everything you need to know about sailing and windsurfing

Find out everything you need to know about windsurfing and sailing at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games! Dive into the history of these fascinating sports, the venues and dates of the competitions, and the French athletes to watch. Don't miss any of the events taking place in Marseille! [Read more]
